Lyceum will not use or share your Personal Information with anyone except as described in this Privacy Policy. The use of information collected through Our Sites shall be limited to the purposes under this Privacy Policy and Our Terms of Service

2. Information You Provide to us Directly
2. Information You Provide to us Directly
Lyceum collects Personal Information from you in the following scenarios:
a) When you subscribe for any of Lyceum’s Service(s) by agreeing to the Terms;

b) When you submit web forms on Our Website(s) or as you use interactive features of the Website(s), including providing feedback or suggestions, making requests, or participation in surveys, contests, webinars, events, podcasts, promotions, sweepstakes, requesting customer support, or otherwise communicating with us;
c) When you provide testimonials, case studies, forms or information to us in other contexts; or

d) When you choose to leverage Our integration with certain platforms, Lyceum solicits your permission to gain access to your account including email messages, contacts and calendar. Lyceum may store a subset of this information in Our servers, as specified in Section 6.1, when you choose to track the videos that you sent via the platform selected and Hippo Video’s integration.
3. Information Lyceum Collects That is Not Provided by You
3. Information Lyceum Collects That is Not Provided by You

When a User interacts with Our application, Lyceum tracks information such as IP, location, device information and browser information. Lyceum also tracks information on how an individual landed on the Hippo Video Website.

A log of all User-generated requests is maintained to debug in case the need arises. This includes User information such as IP, location, OS information, browser, device type and the time which the User interacted with the platform. These log files are encrypted and will be retained for a period of three (3) months.

Lyceum may collect your personal information or data from third parties or websites to whom you have given your personal data through your browser. Browsers generally have a “Do not track” policy. If you don’t want to be tracked, you must enable this option on every browser you use.
3.4 Uploaded Content and Third Party Information:

When you post audio-visual materials to your website or to a third party website, we may collect information about your account and the use of the content that you may post. If you use Our invitation features, such as chats and sending invitations to friends, Lyceum may collect some information from them.
Lyceum may also collect or receive your Personal Information from other sources such as:

a) Lyceum’s business or channel partners through which you create or access your Account, such as marketing service providers, social media services or apps or websites that use Lyceum’s APIs or whose APIs Lyceum uses.
c) Lists or databases but only where We have checked that these third parties either have your consent or are otherwise legally permitted or required to disclose your Personal Information to us,
e) Through the combining of information We obtain from third parties along with the Personal Information you provide to Us
f) Web beacons, tags, scripts and other similar technologies to recognise visitors, track website navigation and understand advertising campaign effectiveness and/or
g) When you consent to Our use of cookies. For more information on how Lyceum uses cookies, please refer to
4. Purposes for Which Personal Data will be Processed
4. Purposes for Which Personal Data will be Processed
Lyceum Processes your Personal Data in the following scenarios:
a) to facilitate your access and use of the Website(s) and Service(s).
b) to process and complete payment transactions.
c) to provide customer service and support.
d) to send you communication on your use of the Service(s), updates on Our Terms or other policies.
e) to send you communication on new features in the Service(s) or new service offerings.

f) to conduct research, analysis and development activities (including but not limited to data analytics, surveys and/or profiling) to improve Our Service(s) and facilities in order to enhance your relationship with Us or for your benefit or to improve any of Our Service(s) for your benefit.
g) to organise seminars, events or other marketing/ promotional activities.
h) to investigate and prevent fraudulent transactions, unauthorized access to the Websites and Service(s), and other illegal activities.
i) to personalize the Websites and Service(s) including to show you advertising that you may be interested in as explained in Section 4.2.

j) in the event Lyceum merges with or is acquired by another company, sells Lyceum’s Websites, Mobile Application(s), or business units, or if all or a substantial portion of Lyceum’s assets are acquired by another company. In such cases, your information will likely be one of the assets that is transferred; and
k) for other purposes for which Lyceum obtains your consent.

Lyceum may with third-party partners and vendors, use technologies such as cookies, pixels, and web beacons to collect and store information about you when you use or interact with Our Website and Services in order to provide you with targeted advertising based on your browsing activities and interests. When Lyceum Processes your order where you are a subscriber, it may send your Personal Data to and also use the resulting information from credit reference agencies to prevent fraudulent purchases.

Lyceum shares Personal Data with Our third-party service providers that host and maintain the Lyceum Website(s), applications, backup, storage, payment processing, analytics and other services. These third-party service providers may have access to or Process your Personal Data for the purpose of providing these services for Us.

6. Connecting Your Email Account via Social Media
6. Connecting Your Email Account via Social Media

You can choose to provide explicit consent to connect your email accounts with your Account. Once connected, Lyceum will securely access and analyse the relevant contents related to the Services provided by Lyceum. Lyceum encourages you to review your Personal Information prior to signing in through the applicable service. Where Lyceum has your authorisation, Lyceum may store your email messages, email messages headers, message bodies, or attachments.

Further, Our Site includes social media features and widgets that are either hosted by a third-party or hosted directly on Our Site; Your interaction with these social media features and widgets is governed by the privacy statement of the companies that provide them. Ensure that you check your privacy settings on these third-party services to understand and change the information sent to Us through these Services. This data may be combined with the other information Lyceum collects and might include aggregated levels of specific data.

If you are a data subject from the European Economic Area, Our legal basis for collecting and using the Personal Information described above will depend on the Personal Information concerned and the specific context in which Lyceum collects it. Lyceum will normally collect Personal Information from you only where it is needed to perform a contract with you, where the processing is in Our legitimate interests and not overridden by your data protection interests or fundamental rights and freedoms, or where Lyceum has your consent. In some cases, Lyceum may also have a legal obligation to collect Personal Information from you. If Lyceum Processes your Personal Information with reliance on your consent, you may withdraw your consent at any time. If you have questions or need further information concerning the legal basis on which Lyceum collects and uses your Personal Information, please contact Us at the email address provided in Section 14.

Lyceum mainly Processes Personal Data in the United States of America. However, it may transfer Personal Data outside the United States of America for the purposes referred to in Section 4 and 5. Lyceum will ensure that the recipient of your Personal Data offers an adequate level of protection that is at least comparable to that which is provided under applicable data protection laws.
Lyceum retains the Personal Data collected where an ongoing legitimate business requires retention of such Personal Data.

In the absence of a need to retain Personal Data under Section 9.1. above, Lyceum will either delete or aggregate it in accordance with the Terms or, if this is not possible then Lyceum will securely store your Personal Data and isolate it from any further Processing until deletion is possible.

Lyceum uses appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect the Personal Data that it collects and Processes. The measures Lyceum uses are designed to provide a level of security appropriate to the risk of Processing your Personal Data. If you have questions about the security of your Personal Data, please contact Us immediately as described in this Policy.
You are entitled to the following rights:
You are entitled to know whether Lyceum holds your Personal Information and the purpose your Personal Information is processed for.

You are entitled to obtain a copy of your Personal Information, together with an explanation of the categories of Personal Information being processed, the purposes of such processing, and the details of third parties to whom the Personal Information may have been disclosed to.
You are entitled to correct/update your Personal Information available with us.

You are entitled to get your Personal Information erased from Our customer relationship management (CRM) databases. Please note that Lyceum needs to retain certain Personal Information about you for legal and internal business reasons, such as fraud prevention. Lyceum will retain your Personal Information for as long as necessary to provide you with the websites and apps you are eligible to use and as needed to comply with our legal obligations and enforce our agreements.

You are entitled to obtain and reuse your Personal Information. You can either obtain the Personal Information from us or, in turn, provide it to a third party (if you so wish), or ask us to transfer your Personal Information directly to a third party.
11.6 Right to object/restrict processing or both:

You have a right to object/restrict the processing of your Personal Information in some circumstances, including where the Personal Information is inaccurate (for the period during which Lyceum is verifying the Personal Information), the Personal Information is no longer required in light of the purpose of processing, or in connection with direct marketing (you can prevent/discontinue marketing communications to you by checking certain boxes on the forms Lyceum uses to collect your Personal Information), or by utilizing opt-out mechanisms in the emails Lyceum sends you.

In the above cases, Lyceum will retain minimum Personal Information to note that you opted out from being contacted again. For the exercise of any of the above-mentioned rights, please write to us at the email address provided in Section 14.

Lyceum recognizes the importance of children's safety and privacy. Lyceum does not request, or knowingly collect, any personally identifiable information from children under the age of 18. Our Subscribers may while using our Services relating to education and training collect information from children under the age of 18. In such cases, it is the Subscriber’s responsibility to comply with applicable law, and obtain consent from a parent or guardian before transmitting this information to Lyceum. Lyceum is very sensitive to privacy issues regarding children. If a parent or guardian becomes aware that his or her child has provided us with Personal Information, he or she should write to us at the email address provided in Section 14.

Lyceum Technologies Inc. keeps this Policy under regular review and may update this webpage at any time. This Policy may be amended at any time and You shall be notified only if there are material changes to this Policy.
If you have any questions/ concerns regarding Our Privacy Policy, feel free to send us an email at
. Lyceum will revert to you within a maximum of 15 business days.
15. Notice to EndUser and Other Exclusions
15. Notice to EndUser and Other Exclusions

Where the Services are made available to an End-User through an enterprise, that enterprise is the Controller of the End-User’s Personal Information. In such a case, the End-User’s data privacy questions and requests should be submitted to the subscriber in its capacity as the End-User’s Controller. If the End-User is an individual who interacts with a subscriber using Our Services, the End-User will be directed to contact Our subscriber for assistance with any requests or questions relating to their Personal Information. Lyceum is not responsible for subscribers’ privacy or security practices which may be different from this notice. Subscribers to Our Services are solely responsible for establishing policies for and ensuring compliance with all applicable laws and regulations, as well as all privacy policies, agreements, or other obligations, relating to the collection of Personal Information in connection with the use of Our Services by End-Users.

With the exception of Personal Information collected when you register for an account to access or utilize Our Service(s) and other information Lyceum collects in connection with their registration or authentication into Our Service(s), this Notice does not apply in connection with access and use of Our Service(s). The security and privacy practices, including how Lyceum protects, collect, and use electronic data, text, messages, communications, or other materials submitted to and stored within the Service(s) by the User, are detailed in and governed by Our Terms or such other applicable agreement between the subscriber and Us relating to the access to and the use of such Services.

Some of the functionality on Our Website(s) may be provided by third parties that are not affiliated with Lyceum. These entities may collect or receive certain information about your use of Our Website and your activities over time and across different websites, including through the use of cookies, web beacons, and similar technologies. This Privacy Policy does not apply to, and Lyceum is not responsible for, third-party cookies, web beacons, or other tracking technologies. Lyceum is not responsible for the privacy practices of these entities. Also, Our Services may contain links to other websites not operated or controlled by Lyceum. Such websites are not under Our control and Lyceum is not responsible for their privacy policies or practices. If you provide any Personal Information through any such third-party website, Lyceum recommends that you familiarize yourself with the privacy policies and practices of that third party and also you also consent to the terms of service/use and privacy policies of these third parties.
